text: Little River County is a county located on the southwest border of the U.S. state of Arkansas, bordering a corner with Texas and Oklahoma. As of the 2020 census, the population was 12,026. The county seat is Ashdown. The county was founded on March 5, 1867, and named for the Little River. == References == Category:1860s establishments in Arkansas Category:1867 establishments in the United States Category:Arkansas counties
title: Little River County, Arkansas
